attributes.action: Call for an early election with support for proportional representation.
attributes.background: At a time where the country is in need of leadership, our representation has failed a public of diverse views. Reform is urgently needed to support a liberal democracy, with proportional representation; where ministers are elected based on their qualifications to represent a sector; all views count.
attributes.additional_details:
The lead up to the EU Referendum in the UK has exposed our leaders as being at odds with the public they are meant to serve. A vote of no confidence is required, not just in the party leaders and our Prime Minister, but also in the way the public are represented, and the way in which decisions are made on public services.

We, the undersigned, call for an early election - within the year; with reform for proportional representation and the right to elect ministers based on their qualifications.

attributes.action: All pledges in democratic elections and referendums should be legally binding.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum result is based upon a campaign of misinformation.  This is not democratic since the public are not being told the truth. All elections pledges should be clear and legally binding. Any politician found to be deliberately misleading the public should be convicted of fraud.

attributes.action: Can you please just raise the speed limit to 80 as 70 is ancient.
attributes.background: I want this petition to go forward as I can not see the point of a 70mph speed limit when on the motorway it feels dangerous as cars fly past well over that and I do not want to break the law to maintain a safe flow of traffic .there is no money for better policing and you cannot fine everybody
attributes.additional_details: Other countries as Czech Republic Romania and Germany all have higher speed limits and this would lower intimidating driving

attributes.action: Give all teenagers aged under 18 on 23.6.16 a vote in a supplemental referendum.
attributes.background: Allowing teenagers to vote in a supplementary EU referendum will be good for the future of Britain’s democracy, because whatever the final outcome they will have had the opportunity to participate in the decision. Their votes can be added to the June ballot and the result recalculated.

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Remove the titles Mrs, Miss and Ms from all government forms.
attributes.background: Titles for women are sexist and discriminatory, and provide marital status information about them that men do not have to divulge. Even having the Ms option gives some people a preconception about that person. All titles fields should be removed from document and computer forms.

attributes.action: Property buyers must be British citizens, not corporations or overseas investors
attributes.background: In a time that overpopulation and immigration are hot topics, we need to use the space we have to accommodate the people that make Britain great. In order for this to happen, we need to stop properties being able to be bought by anonymous foreign investors for their own economic gain.
attributes.additional_details: Over £120bn of British properties are owned by offshore companies, who don't pay the same taxes as us to the government, and often don't occupy the housing they own. The Standard revealed investors had bought at least £100 billion of property in the capital using overseas companies. The Land Registry figures also show that in just one deal signed off by Boris Johnson in 2011, at Riverlight Quay in the Nine Elms regeneration area, 15% of the homes sold so far have been bought by foreign firms.

attributes.action: Change the law to clarify election expenses and end the current controversy.
attributes.background:
The government should end the current controversy over allegations of electoral fraud by changing the law such that the rules are made unambiguous.
If the party in question apologises for the mistake and the affected members step down there should be no need for expensive investigations.
attributes.additional_details:
Either this issue stems from an honest mistake or it does not.
If it is an honest mistake then the only reasonable course of action is to own up and try to set it straight.
If it is not an honest mistake, then it appears to be a callous and calculated plot perpetrated by a corruption that runs through the heart of the party.

attributes.action: If Asia Bibi is executed we should 'cease trading' with Pakistan immediately.
attributes.background: Asia Bibi, a Christian, offered water to a Muslim woman. She refused as it had been handled by a 'dirty animal and dirty Christian'. She was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to death because she said 'Jesus may have a different viewpoint to Mohammed'.
attributes.additional_details: Daily Express 1 June 2016. Asia Bibi offered water to a Muslim woman who “I said ‘I think Jesus would have a different viewpoint to Mohammed’, the woman said ‘how dare you question the prophet, dirty animal’ and a 'dirty Christian'. She was found guilty by a Pakistan court of blasphemy and sentenced to death.This, by inference, is saying all Christians including our Queen as Head of Commonwealth and also Church of England is also. STOP trading, giving AID and eject from Commonwealth.

attributes.action: The Government to start an official trial on the safety of e-cig/vape products
attributes.background: I have been a vaper for 6 years and feel much better than when I was a smoker.  I have not even had a cold for 3 years which means no trips to the doctors or prescriptions!!
attributes.additional_details: Although there may be dodgy products on the market...this can equate to dodgy iPhone chargers.  Exploding batteries....ever heard of mobile phones exploding/setting on fire.  E-cigs/vaping products need to be officially tested and for the scare tactics to stop once and for all

attributes.action: Let all serving forces personnel grow a full beard.
attributes.background: Using the same guidelines as the Royal Navy, allow all serving personnel for all UK forces to grow and maintain a beard.

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for travellers to pay for cleaning up once they have moved on
attributes.background: Some travellers who break into land cause damage which they do not have to pay for. This is wrong and creates a system with no incentive to stop them doing it again.
attributes.additional_details:
Around where we live land has been damaged including the local football field. It costs money to get court orders and repair the damage. 

All the council’s costs involved could and should be used for local people instead of wasted due to a lack of punishment to deter this behaviour.

attributes.action: Ensure that students from year7 are taught in schools how to detect child abuse.
attributes.background: We're a group of students that believe that child abuse needs to be reduced. We have found astonishing figures that kids 4 years old and under are most affected. Most kids that have been physically, verbally or sexually abused are unaware that they are being abused as they don't understand the signs
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 5 children die every day because of child abuse and 1 out of 3 girls and 1 out of 5 boys will be sexually abused before they reach age 18.
For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering alone

attributes.action: Require transport authorities to fund free concessionary fares for unpaid carers
attributes.background: Unpaid Carers (carers who do not provide care as a career) are a crucial part of society saving the government £162 billion every year. Travel is an essential service and yet, is a barrier that makes it harder for us to deal with our many responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: Public transport is a service that is a need, we are an essential part of the community so why can't we use it too! Not everyone can get benefits so let's help carers get what they deserve, it may not seem important to most but to many it will change their lives. We deserve to be treated as equals...Is free/concessionary transport for carers to much to ask for in return for those who dedicate their lives to care for others?

attributes.action: Review extra funding for m60 ring road and m56 and other adjoining motorways
attributes.background: Traffic chaos all around m60 ring road ever y day adding as much as 2 hours on to the journey , major problems Include m56 junctions 3 to 1 heading East to m60 anticlockwise at junction 3 cheadle
attributes.additional_details: M56 narrows to 2 lanes to join m60 4lanes to 2 causes bottleneck and traffic increasing up to 500,000 annually , nationally

attributes.action: all road traffic accidents with police attendance should have a written report
attributes.background: 18 months ago I was knocked off my motorbike whilst filtering slow moving traffic by somebody who went to change lane without indicating, and with no police report and a witness who doesn't seem to want to give a statement I'm struggling to prove the events with my insurance company.
attributes.additional_details: The day after my accident I called the police and spoke to the attending officer who confirmed I was knocked off whilst filtering and the other driver had attempted to change lane without indicating. I also called the witness who confirmed that I was travelling in a safe manner and the other driver swerved to change lane without indicating and obviously being unaware of his surroundings and myself.

attributes.action: Impose stiffer penalties for hand held mobile phone use in vehicles.
attributes.background:
Use of such phones is not diminishing . Evidence from police force videos shows drivers talking and texting or viewing smartphone content. 
Phone logs time stamp usage
Current penalties are not fit for purpose. 
The consequences of accidents caused by such drivers are totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
A Zero Tolerance deterrent is urgently needed to make the results of a conviction more meaningful to the driver and on a par with the offence of drink-driving.  

- An immediate suspension of the driving licence upon apprehension

- On conviction, automatic 12 month disqualification, 6 points on the    licence and £1000 fine, plus seizure of the mobile device.

- If convicted a second time, the courts should be allowed to impose unlimited disqualification, fine or even imprisonment.

attributes.action: Binding quota of gender representation in all public & government offices
attributes.background: Currently the male and female population are not equally presented in UK public & government offices. The UK is ranked 49th in the world with regards to the number of women in national parliaments.  Norway implements a binding quota: each gender is represented by a minimum of 40% of members.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 UK General Election: men made up 71% of MPs; 74% of Members of House of Lords; 68% of elected councillors; 87% of local authority council leaders.  Women make up 43% of Labour MPs, 21% of Conservative MPs, 36% of SNP MPs, 13% of elected mayors. While the majority of medical students are female and 80% of NHS staff are women, women make up just 28% of trust chairs. We need binding quotas, the appropriate framework & effective sanctions for noncompliance. Lets implement binding quotas.

attributes.action: Make patent infringement a criminal offence in the UK.
attributes.background: Patent infringement is commonplace. Personally and according to the Intellectual Property's Office's opinion I have experienced this directly.  However, as individual or small business trying to stop such trespass the cost is prohibitive as the penalties for unauthorised IPR's use is insufficient.
attributes.additional_details: Innovators who develop products look to protect such technology.  Enjoying rewards from inspiration made real are huge motivators. However, it is true to say, "patents are not worth the paper they are written on if not policed".  Unauthorised patent use is crushing for those who lack means. Business know this and take comfort at little or no penalty for their actions.  Our world is built on ideas, so why do we not protect the innovators? Steal the idea, steals the motivation and steals growth.

attributes.action: Make care for teenagers/young adults with disabilities free for working parents.
attributes.background: As a continually working parent of a child with a disability, it is impossible to find child care for my son either reasonably priced or even available. Unless I have a family member to look after my son outwith school hours I cannot work. Let's make this care available and free for working parents.

attributes.action: Invoke NATO Article 4 consultation on establishing a "No-Fly" zone over Syria.
attributes.background: Syrian and Russian airstrikes target civilian population centres, schools and medical centres, weaponising refugees and making living in non government areas untenable. This not only constitutes a warcrime but effectively endangers NATO and EU cohesion, as a planned and desired secondary objective.
attributes.additional_details:
A "No-Fly" zone would force the Syrian and Russian regime to take the peace talks seriously, stop the scheduled and intentional murder of innocent civilians and allow for the implementation of much needed humanitarian aid. It would also be an effective first step in allowing Syrian refugees to return home.

Secondly we respectfully request that her Majesty's government petition the International Tribunal in the Hague to prosecute those who planned, ordered and willingly executed said warcrimes.

attributes.action: Make Ebooks (Kindle, etc) free from VAT.
attributes.background: Books are zero rated in UK for VAT because of their cultural and educational value. However, Ebooks (e.g. those delivered to Kindle etc) are not, but are hit by 20% VAT. Given that 'virtual' books do not require  destruction of forests, printing and distribution this is clearly unfair. Zero rate now

attributes.action: Health Research Tax on all UK Taxpayers - let's finally cure Cancer and the rest
attributes.background:
A new tax used to fund Health Research, a small amount taken every month from all taxpayers and used to fund medical research. Suggested monthly figure for UK tax brackets:

Basic - 40p
Higher - 50p
Additional - £1

Such a small amount per person will generate £100m+ per year (HMRC Stats).
attributes.additional_details:
Based on HMRC Stats for 2016 tax year:

24.7m Basic rate = £9.8m
4.4m Higher rate = £2.2m
0.3m Additional rate = £0.3m
Total = £12.4m p/m

Funds to be given to single disease until cured then move to next (order TBD).

Suggest management board made of unpaid visionaries who are only interested in making the world better (i.e. Musk, Branson, Dyson etc.)

The Ice Bucket Challenge raised £87m for ALS research leading to the discovery of a gene that will allow them to start developing treatments.

attributes.action: Reduce the payment of stamp duty to 0% for British Armed Forces personnel
attributes.background:
Armed Forces personnel, by virtue of work, are likely to move around more as a result of posting. Moving home every 2-3 years can be
costly incurring legal fees and tax. To reduce this cost, incured as a result of the employment, stamp duty could be reduced to 0% for residential property purchase
attributes.additional_details: With my current property 2 years on the market at a price below market value and still unable to sell. When I return from serving overseas I will incur 3% stamp duty to buy a new home close to where I work. I face this, paying full rent for a property or living in a single man room where I have little choice over food and little privacy, Im 43 I dont wish to live like a student, I would like to afford my own space.

attributes.action: Extend the 'Aiming High for Young People' Plan
attributes.background: The 'Aiming High for Young People Plan' provides young people with funding and comfort, as well as an escape for troubled kids. Without the appropriate places for young people to stay off the streets, crime has statistically increased in these areas.
attributes.additional_details: By next year, the government will stop providing a place of comfort for young people in every consistentuency, the government will stop providing £25 million for teenagers in disadvantaged communities, and the government will stop providing young people influence over local authority funding. This needs to be changed. We, as gatekeepers for the next generation, must make sure the youth develop with the optimum funding and appreciation. The futures of millions of children holds in the balance.

attributes.action: Have a new runway at both Gatwick and Heathrow
attributes.background: If this Government decides on one or other it won't be long before we'll have the whole debate again. Having spare capacity at both airports will be an operational relief and set us up for the next decades.

attributes.action: Stop all DWP benefit payment sanctions immediately.
attributes.background:
It is basically unethical and unhealthy.
The UN agree - It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in B
attributes.additional_details:
THE United Nations committee on economic and cultural rights recently published a highly damning report.
It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in Britain.
The report considers a number of areas, all of which are drastically important to our everyday lives. . . . 
 foodbanks, unemployment rates, the housing crisis, mental health care and discrimination against migrants and disabled people.

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC and sell all assets for the NHS to save people £150 pa for life
attributes.background: The BBC has become an expensive white elephant with anything but a public service as its main goal. It is becoming extremely political and targeting minorities and politicians alike. It is time to make good use of its assets by selling it all and earmaking all proceeds to go to the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The use of subliminal images by the BBC in targeting minorities or immigrants or even Scotland is disgusting. It has political agendas far beyond its remit and even targets politicians. Even if you do not like Jeremy Cobyn, one day it could be any other politician which does not serve the ultimate controller of the BBC.

The NHS which is depleted and suffering could make better use of these resources for the welfare of the nation. And people would be less taxed too by its excesses of the BBC.

attributes.action: Make killing a cat or dog with a vehicle a criminal offence
attributes.background:
On Friday 13th of May my life was forever changed.
My much loved cat was run over and killed outside my house. I was on my way to work when my neighbour called to break the news. I had to come home and take my cat to be cremated the same day and was off work for a week as a result with stress.
attributes.additional_details: I reviewed my CCTV footage and can see only one car drive down my road from when the cat goes over the fence until someone clearly picks him up and places him on the pavement. the car in question can't be positively identified but was going at some speed and made no attempt to swerve, slow down or stop after the event. This attitude that family pets are not important enough to make a law to protect has bred this type of attitude and I for one think this is wrong and needs addressing

attributes.action: Introduce licenses for pet ownership
attributes.background: More and more pets are going missing as well as stolen. As well as this, dog fighting is still in existence. By introducing licenses we can reduce this and know that pets are in a safe home through the checks owners must go through to own any animal.
attributes.additional_details: I run a group on Facebook and everyday there are more missing pets. Dog fighting still exists and in a recent report it has stated dog fighting happened every day. Licenses will require the owner to pass simple knowledge and possibly even annual checks to be sure the pet is safe. This would work well with a register listing all animal abusers so they do not hurt an animal again as they wont have a license to buy pets. In addition stop the ban on the four dogs. With responsible owners these dogs do not need to be banned.

attributes.action: Don't implement GCSE exam 9-1 grades, instead have A*, A, B*, B, C*, C, D, E, F.
attributes.background: The justification for swapping from A*-G to 9-1 can be found on the gov.uk webpage in additional details. After reading it I hope you agree it will just serve to cause massive confusion for employers & students. The system I propose keeps the the new 9 grades but is comparable to existing ones.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/setting-standards-for-new-gcses-in-2017

http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/jun/02/ofqual-survey-finds-wide-confusion-and-doubts-about-gcse-and-a-level-changes

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/teachers-confused-over-new-numerical-gcse-grading-system

attributes.action: Make sanitary bins in male toilets compulsory for the transgender community.
attributes.background: I would like male toilets to have sanitation bins as the transgender community will be able to feel more comfortable and not have to use the female toilets if they are menstruating. This will promote self esteem among the transgender community.
attributes.additional_details: As gender neutral toilets are gradually coming into place, I believe it is very appropriate that the transgender community is made to feel as comfortable as they can be. The cost of the sanitation bins are very little and extremely convenient. The bins will be used if the trans* man is menstruating. He will then be able to use the male bathroom and feel comfortable doing so.

attributes.action: The Government to discuss increase in racism brought about by the referrendum.
attributes.background:
There have been worringly increasing reports about the rise in racism since the referrendum has started and appears to have become worse since the UK voted to leave.
The UK is a multi-cultural nation and no-one should be made to feel subordinate or threatened in they're home.
attributes.additional_details: Bbc news 'go back home' article

attributes.action: Hold a vote to find out if the country wants a second EU referendum
attributes.background: The Leave campaign has distanced itself from their pre-referendum statements, has no post referendum plan and many people who voted out have changed their mind. We, the undersigned feel that this would be the only democratic route to gauge opinion and offer a way to unite the country once again.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum where it is illegal  to knowingly misrepresent the facts
attributes.background: Many people voted in The EU referendum based on statements which campaign Leaders have admitted were mistakes.  We believe there would have been a different outcome if it was illegal to make false representations to the public and call on the outcome to be set aside and a new referendum to be held

attributes.action: England (w/o London) and Wales become independent and get only them out of EU
attributes.background: In the wake of the Brexit referendum results there are different calls for the breakup of UK. An alternative solution to satisfy the voters, keep UK whole and partially within EU would be to devolve England (w/o London) and Wales and let them leave EU (like Crown dependencies currently are).

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Pass a law prohibiting or limiting referendums
attributes.background:
Parliament should pass a law either prohibiting referendums or requiring that the result that would change the status quo would need to achieve more than two-thirds of the votes cast to pass.

The current EU referendum demonstrates that too often they are - disruptive, divisive and distracting.
attributes.additional_details:
We live in a representative democracy. It is important that people have a say in their own government but it is equally important that we avoid a tyranny of the majority and that on particular issues voting proceeds on the basis of knowledge and understanding. Representative democracy, for all its flaws, achieves that goal better than any referendum can.

Meanwhile the referendum process distracts from other issues, falsely turns complex questions into binary choices and fosters division.

attributes.action: Give domiciliary carers car maintenance funds per year.
attributes.background: I am carer in the community and my wages just about cover fuel and bills. I love my job but many of us carers cant pay for the wear and tear, that the daily usage is damaging our cars, by using it for up to 12hrs a day.
attributes.additional_details: I have found no extra help of funding/loans to help me get my car fixed and risk loosing my job

attributes.action: Ban residential bonfires during Summer.
attributes.background:
We don't get too many sunny days in the UK, but when we do you know someone locally will be having a bonfire! 

I want to petition the government to stop residential bonfires during the summer months from when the clocks go forward until the clocks go back.

attributes.action: Ban MMA and regulate the beauty industry with checks from local councils
attributes.background:
MMA causes injuries and health problems. Beauty therapists are not currently checked for accredited qualifications, insurance and hygiene.
This has led to numerous reports of injuries and litigation that could be avoided with regular checks and a formal register.

attributes.action: Reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber of devolved assemblies
attributes.background: To reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber for every devolved Parliament and Assembly in the United Kingdom to promote good governance while reducing the future burden on the taxpayers of the Realm with unnecessary duplication across the nation.

attributes.action: Stop UK Gap Year travel companies placing volunteers in orphanages abroad.
attributes.background:
1. 80% of children in homes in Asia and Africa are NOT orphans.
2. Short-term volunteers disrupt the welfare of the children.
3. It is illegal in many countries to volunteer on a Visitor's Visa.
4. Many orphanages force children to convert from their family religion in return support.
attributes.additional_details:
These conditions violate the terms of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child to a home, family, community, religion.
http://www.nextgenerationnepal.org/File/The-Paradox-of-Orphanage-Volunteering.pdf
http://globalsl.org/why-unicef-and-save-the-children-are-against-you-caring-for-orphans/
http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jan/02/cambodia-child-protection-workers-call-for-end-to-booming-orphanage-tourism
http://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/may/16/volunteers-stop-visiting-orphanages-start-preserving-families

attributes.action: Stop Social Services Early Intervention/unnecessary Adoption threats
attributes.background: That the Social Services are using Early Intervention even when not necessary to instigate threats of Adoption so as to meet internal quotas as set up by Ofsted and the Adoption Agencies
attributes.additional_details:
The case of Pauline Goodwin June 2005 Mother approached whilst in Hospital having just given birth, then 3 days later given court order to leave the child in the care of said hospital,.

Some critics state there are financial incentives for Local Authorities to secure adoptions, due to increased funding for social services units that effectively place a greater number of children with adopted families

attributes.action: Teach about the full LGBTQ* spectrum as part of the PSHE curriculum.
attributes.background: If the government made it mandatory for students to be taught about the LGBTQ* spectrum I feel it would drastically decrease bullying and ignorance, as well as making students possibly feel better about themselves if they understand that their feelings are normal.
attributes.additional_details: As a high school student myself I have noticed a distinct lack of education regarding LGBTQ* people, despite the fact that 1 in every 10 people is either lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into privately contracted benefit assessments by the DWP
attributes.background: Channel 4 Dispatches has revealed a systematic agenda to cut benefit payments by Capita, contracted for the DWP for Personal Independence Payment assessments alongside Atos. There is evidence to suggest systematic fraud and abuse of vulnerable adults by these companies. We call for a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.channel4.com/info/press/news/the-great-benefits-row-channel-4-dispatches

attributes.action: Prevent women from fighting in close combat roles in the British Armed Forces.
attributes.background:
- If a woman wants to serve on the frontline, they need to meet the same physical criteria as men, otherwise lives will be put at risk.
- It would cause discontent among serving members of the armed forces, with many threatening to leave if this becomes policy.
attributes.additional_details:
- Women should not qualify for combat roles with lower physical capabilities, for example they might have to carry a heavy male, with full armour to save his life.

- It would cloud judgement of male counterparts, who would instinctively choose to save a woman if two people's lives were in danger, despite not always being the right decision to take.

- Women, in the main, cannot carry 110lb on their back (as soldiers in Afghanistan did).

- There are already many combat roles open to women.

attributes.action: Require all local councils in England to use LED bulbs in street lights.
attributes.background: Sodium lighting is commonplace in British towns and cities. These orange lights cause a large amount of light pollution and make it difficult for most of us to see a full starry sky [1]. A switch to Amber LED lighting would improve these conditions greatly and would also be more energy efficient [2]
attributes.additional_details:
1. http://nightblight.cpre.org.uk/maps/ - The light pollution map for the UK 
2. http://www1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/publications/pdfs/alliances/outdoor_area_lighting.pdf - The American "Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy'"s report on new LED installation. 
- On the topic of Amber LED: In this case amber is the suggested colour as dimming the LEDs is the key in reducing light pollution emmisions, it also reduces blue-light exposure. http://darksky.org/lighting/led-practical-guide/

attributes.action: Consider a second runway for Gatwick
attributes.background: Why allocate a 3rd runway to Heathrow when Gatwick will fund 2nd runway

attributes.action: Increase the bursary for training English teachers 2016-17
attributes.background:
The government are increasing the bursary for training English teachers from a minimum of £4,000 to £9,000 for all.
Many who are training to teach English this year will only receive £4,000 to cover living expenses. If they had applied this year they would receive over double the amount.
attributes.additional_details:
https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/overview

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/561599/Initial_teacher_training_bursaries_funding_manual_2017_to_2018.pdf
